title: Florentine Humanists: Poliziano, Landino & Lorenzo
description: The brilliant circle around Lorenzo de' Medici: Angelo Poliziano's humanist philology and poetry, Cristoforo Landino's Neoplatonic Dante commentary, Lorenzo's own philosophical verses, and Leone Ebreo's influential dialogue on love.

books.title: Le stanze, Le Orfeo e Le rime
books.author: Angelo Poliziano

books.title: Comento sopra la Comedia di Dante
books.author: Cristoforo Landino

keyFigures: Angelo Poliziano (1454-1494): Greatest humanist philologist, poet, translator
Cristoforo Landino (1424-1498): Neoplatonic philosopher, Dante commentator
Lorenzo de' Medici (1449-1492): 'Il Magnifico' - patron, poet, statesman
Leone Ebreo (c.1460-1521): Jewish physician-philosopher, Neoplatonic love theory
researchValue: Documents the intellectual brilliance of Laurentian Florence. Poliziano's Miscellanea pioneered humanist textual criticism. Landino's Dante commentary spread Neoplatonism. Leone Ebreo's Dialoghi influenced European love poetry and philosophy.
